This weekly bulletin informs students, parents, and staff about internships, academic
programs, jobs, leadership & community service initiatives, and other student
opportunities in a variety of fields. Please carefully note deadlines, age requirements,
and other pre-requisites for participation.
For ease of use, these newsletters are organized by different categories, such as
Academic Programs, Business Internships & Jobs, STEM Opportunities, Community
Service, and so on.
Please note that in order to save space, many sections contain links to general lists
of related opportunities- such as for Stem programs, Community Service, College
Prep free programs, and more - be sure to click on any links that interest you.
Here are a few examples of the excellent opportunities & programs to be found in the
sections below – man ydeadlines are fast-approaching, so interested students should
explore these options and apply ASAP!
EVENTS: There is a STEM Career Expo for high school students at the New York
Hall of Science on May 23rd. It will cover many STEM fields, and is open to all.
ACADEMICS: There is a free Introduction to Calculus course offered by College
Passport on East 12th Street in Manhattan. It meets twice a week for six weeks this
summer, and is open to all students. They also offer a free one-month SAT Prep
course this summer – check the COLLEGE PREP section for that opportunity.
And some of the free CUNY College Now and STEP STEM summer programs are
still accepting applications. There are varying eligibility requirements, check this
section to learn more.
BUSINESS/CAREERS: Some paid opportunities are still open for applications,
including ,among others, the ‘Bee Ambassadors’ (for Brooklyn residents – May 19th
deadline), the Green Guerillas Community Gardens program (for ages 14-17), and
possibly some junior camp counselor positions (check the link provided in this
section).
GOVERNMENT/LEADERSHIP/HISTORY: The NSLI Virtual Language program
starts in September and runs for two months – all students are eligible to apply to learn
Arabic, Chinese, Korean, Turkish & more – no previous knoweldege is required.
ART/MUSEUMS: Several major museums have summer art programs, which often
combine art and museum career learning. These include the Museum of Modern Art
(MOMA Teens – deadline May 23rd),the Whitney Museum (Youth Insights, for
current 9th, 10th, and 11th graders), and the Noguchi Museum’s Making your Mark
opportunity for current 10th and 11th graders.
There is also the New Museum’s two-year NewMuTeen Fellowship paid program,
which meets one a week from September 2025 - June 2027.
STEM: York College in Queens offers a free ‘Aeronautics & Aviation’ six-week
summer program, open to applications from all students.
And the free Stella Adler Summer Shakespeare program is open to students
The Summit STEM Fellowship is a virtual 10-15 hours per week program, with
flexible hours available. It is open to all students, and financial aid is available.
And all students may apply for a free virtual Cybersecurity Class that meets on
Tuesdays and Thursdays during the summer.
THEATER: The New York Theater Workshop meets for five weeks during the
summer, and is open to applications from all students.
The Stella Adler Summer Shakespeare program is open to students with a lower-
income family background.
And several other free & low-cost theater/music/video opportunities are still open –
many deadlines are fast-approaching!
Questions, suggestions, and information about other opportunities are always
welcome and appreciated, and may be sent to Internship/Opportunity Coordinator
Harvey Blumm at: hblumm@stuy.edu - we will share your helpful information with
the Stuy community!
Updated: The TomorrowToday Experience Directory: A new interactive resource
for students and parents!
TomorrowToday is a digital companion to the weekly Student Opportunities Bulletin
empowers students to more easily explore, find, and engage with the many diverse
opportunities that are available in a more interactive way.
How Should Students Use It?
Students can access the directory via our weekly digital bulletin or at the link below.

take the next steps to participate on the provider's website. The user-friendly interface
makes it easy to filter and search for specific opportunities.
